title: Paris Olympics: The 'Seine-sational' Games bid adieu to the public with final star-studded show
summary: Paris is closing out two and a half extraordinary weeks of Olympic sports and emotion with a boisterous, star-studded show in France's national stadium, handing over hosting duties for the Summer Games to the next city in line: Los Angeles in 2028.

title: Paris Olympics closing ceremony, as it happened: Paris Games close, handing over to Los Angeles at ceremony
summary: After two weeks of competitions, the Paris 2024 Olympic Games come to a close on Sunday evening, with a ceremony at the Stade de France. Join us for live coverage.

title: Arthur Cadre, the Paris Olympics closing ceremony's 'Golden Voyager'
summary: The 32-year-old dancer-breaker-contortionist is playing the lead role in 'Records,' the closing ceremony spectacle created and directed by Thomas Jolly.

title: Olympic women's basketball: France endures heartbreaking silver, after 'making the best team in the world quiver'
summary: The French women's basketball team lost the final of the Paris Olympic Games to the US (66-67) on Sunday, August 11, after a memorable duel.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: How the medal table evolved over the two weeks
summary: Our graph shows who was in the lead at any given moment during the Olympics.

title: Mayor of Los Angeles Karen Bass: 'We have learned a lot' from Paris 2024
summary: Karen Bass is in Paris for the last few days of the competition and will receive on Sunday the Olympic flag from Mayor Anne Hidalgo: Los Angeles will be the Games' next host country, in 2028.

title: High-risk Ukrainian offensive for Kyiv in Russia
summary: The entry of Ukrainian troops into Russian territory, in the Kursk region, is a major setback for the Kremlin, but also an additional challenge for Kyiv.

title: Helicopter crashes into Australian hotel roof, pilot dead
summary: Hundreds of patrons were evacuated from the DoubleTree by Hilton, in the tropical northern city of Cairns, after the twin-engine helicopter crashed around 1:50 am local time.

title: Fire breaks out at cooling tower of Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant
summary: Ukraine's interior minister said it was "intensively monitoring" the situation from meteorological stations near the plant, which is Europe's largest nuclear power station.

title: Greece battles wildfires amid high winds, city of Marathon evacuated
summary: By Sunday afternoon, firefighters had quickly dealt with 33 out of the 40 blazes that had broken out in the past 24 hours, a fire brigade spokesman said.

title: Bulgaria: Law banning 'LGBTQ+ propaganda' in schools provokes outrage
summary: The Bulgarian parliament's surprise adoption of a homophobic law could strain relations between Brussels and Sofia.

title: Israeli strike on school turned shelter dampens ceasefire hopes
summary: Israel said the former school was a 'hideout for Hamas terrorists and commanders.' Over 90 people were killed, many of them women and children.

title: Olympic marathon: Sifan Hassan of the Netherlands wins women's race
summary: The Dutch runner beat Ethiopia Tigst Assefa in a breathtaking finish. Kenya's Hellen Obiri took bronze.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: The best photos from the two weeks of competition
summary: Le Monde has selected the most striking photos of the Olympic fortnight, from the opening ceremony on the Seine on July 26 to the final events.

title: Steph Curry and Team USA shatter France's dream of gold in Olympic basketball final
summary: The US won the gold medal in Paris on Sunday, beating a determined French team (87-98).

title: Eiffel Tower evacuated after man spotted climbing
summary: Authorities have evacuated the Paris landmark after a shirtless man was seen climbing above the Olympic rings hours before the Paris Olympics closing ceremony.

title: US gymnast Jordan Chiles must return bronze medal, says IOC
summary: The Court of Arbitration for Sport said that Jordan Chiles' score was judged improperly, and that her initial score, which would have ranked her fifth, should have stood.

title: Olympic breaking: Dany Dann and the silver medal worth its weight in gold
summary: The French breaker lost in the Olympic Games final to Canadian b-boy Phil Wizard. 'I'm happy for the culture,' he said enthusiastically.

title: Olympic skeet shooting uniforms. Does anyone care?
summary: The Olympic Games are an opportunity to rediscover the elegance and technicality of certain disciplines. Skeet shooting, for example, during the women's final in Châteauroux on August 4.

title: Transportation: an Olympic success to sustain
summary: During the two Olympic weeks, the RATP and SNCF rose to the occasion. Now that the "enchanting interlude of the Games" is over, managing the back-to-school period and the Paralympic Games on the very busy Ile-de-France transit network is the next challenge.

title: With the City of Paris' Olympic volunteers: 'It feels really good'
summary: The 5,300 volunteers, who served as 'city entertainers' throughout the event, worked without pay or reimbursement and had no direct interaction with the athletes. As their two demanding weeks draw to a close this Sunday, they reflect with satisfaction on the unique experience they have shared.

title: Paris Olympics: For French athletes, the public's support was a double-edged sword
summary: While some French athletes thrived on the crowd's energy, others struggled with it. To prepare, several federations had arranged situational simulations.

title: Two weeks of Olympics magic in Paris
summary: For two weeks, the French capital let itself be overtaken by the Olympic spirit and buzzed with sporting performances. A success hailed by all.

title: Paris Olympics: Gold medallist boxer Imane Khelif files complaint over 'moral harassment'
summary: The 25-year-old Algerian woman, who won the Olympic final in her category on Friday, August 9, has been the target for the past week of an online hate campaign regarding her gender identity.

title: Iran is accused of being behind Trump campaign hack and assassination plot
summary: The FBI reports that in mid-July, it arrested a Pakistani man with links to Iran who was planning attacks during the summer of 2024.

title: The very short strike of Italian beach operators
summary: The beach concession system is under threat from a European directive on services, which calls for the implementation of public tenders. This has been a source of conflict between Brussels and Rome for almost 20 years.

title: Phoenix, Air, Billie Eilish, Snoop Dogg and the Red Hot Chili Peppers: The closing ceremony was star-studded
summary: From Zaho de Sagazan to Billie Eilish, via Phoenix, H.E.R. and the Red Hot Chili Peppers, the soundtrack bridged the gap between Paris and Los Angeles.

title: Paris Olympics: Djokovic's racket, Rebeca Andrade's leotard, Aya Nakamura's dress... The IOC museum's treasure hunt
summary: Teams from the Olympic Museum in Lausanne have been diligently acquiring artifacts from the Paris 2024 Games to chronicle the events. This collection, which includes a range of sports memorabilia, has been assembled through a process requiring both patience and diplomacy.

title: Mykhailo Fedorov, Ukrainian minister: 'Asymmetrical warfare means using technologies that the enemy doesn't expect'
summary: The 33-year-old minister of digital transformation piloted the "Army of Drones" project and, in an interview with Le Monde, promotes the integration of new technology on the battlefield.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Closing ceremony provides one last thrill as Paris passes baton to Los Angeles
summary: The closing ceremony of the Paris Olympic Games had a lot to live up to, so high had the bar been set by the success of the Games' opener on the Seine and the joy that transformed Paris for 17 days after it.

title: Tom Cruise, a messenger fallen from the heavens at the 2024 Olympics closing ceremony
summary: On Sunday, August 11, actor Tom Cruise made a spectacular live appearance at the Stade de France during the closing ceremony of the 2024 Olympic Games, descending from the sky before embarking on a motorcycle journey in a video, ultimately delivering the Olympic flag to Los Angeles.

title: Paris 2024: The closing ceremony's most beautiful images
summary: The widely-praised Paris Olympics came to an end in a dazzling closing ceremony at the Stade de France on Sunday.

title: The success of the Paris Olympics cannot have no tomorrow
summary: From the opening ceremony to the final bang at the Stade de France on Sunday, France managed to defy all the clichés about itself, its history and its people. The question now is what it will do with this success.

title: The closing night at Club France, the home of French fans
summary: More than 600,000 people flocked to the site during the Olympic fortnight, enjoying big-screen broadcasts of events alongside sports-themed advertising stands, or meeting their favorite athletes in the flesh.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Last-chance negotiations for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip
summary: More than 80 people died on Saturday in strikes targeting a Gaza school that had been turned into a refuge. A summit organized by the mediators in the conflict (US, Egypt, Qatar) is scheduled for August 15 in a regional capital.

title: Greece: Thousands flee as wildfires approach Athens
summary: Residents near the Greek capital were told by authorities to flee their homes, while the city of Marathon is facing a 'catastrophe.' The country is experiencing its hottest summer since records began.

title: 'Pure Hollywood,' Paris 'wins a gold medal': Foreign press leaves glowing reviews for 2024 Olympics
summary: With the final bell rung for the Olympic Games, the international press is still raving about the spectacle that Paris provided − and Los Angeles worries that it's a tough act to follow.

title: Bangladesh's students take charge of policing the capital
summary: Fearing retaliation, the police remain in hiding. The students, yesterday's revolutionaries, have now become peacekeepers.

title: Olympic Games showed world 'the true face of France,' says Macron
summary: 'We don't want life to get back to normal,' President Emmanuel Macron said, the day after the closing ceremony.

title: Biles, Duplantis, Team USA: International stars shined at the Paris Games
summary: From the return of US gymnast Simone Biles to the world record set by Swedish pole vaulter Armand Duplantis, we look back at some of this year's outstanding performances.

title: Five-time Olympic medalist Tom Daley retires from diving
summary: The 30-year-old British diving sensation made the announcement on Monday, after competing in his fifth Olympics, having started in Beijing in 2008.

title: Paris 2024: Mission accomplished for France's Olympic team
summary: With 64 medals and fifth place in the medal table, the French delegation achieved its objectives and broke its records. The effects of these efforts should be felt throughout the coming Olympiad.

title: Banksy unveils rhino mural in London, eighth piece in eight days
summary: The street artist's latest works have all been animal-themed.

title: Animal welfare at the 2024 Olympics: The horse comes first
summary: Since the setbacks in Tokyo in 2021, the equestrian world has improved its image in terms of the 'well-treatment' of horses.

title: Authorities investigate British man who climbed Eiffel Tower
summary: The Eiffel Tower was evacuated ahead of the Paris Olympics closing ceremony after the man was spotted climbing it.

title: Women's Tour de France: Kool claims yellow jersey with stage 1 victory
summary: Dutch rider Charlotte Kool claimed a victory at home as the race started in Rotterdam and headed to The Hague.
